sentences.english: The prince apparently held hands with his fiancée as they walked slowly to the island where Princess Diana was laid to rest.
sentences.chinese: 王子與凱特手牽手，慢慢來到黛安娜王妃長眠的小島。

sentences.english: Let them sleep in their maggoty beds.
sentences.chinese: 讓他們在爬滿了蛆的牀上長眠去吧。

sentences.english: She is sleeping on the Ili Grassland.
sentences.chinese: 她就長眠在伊犁的草原上。

sentences.english: A cat, as always immoral, was falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一向邪惡的貓，長眠不醒。

sentences.english: Lord Iknow when Ilay me down 2sleep.
sentences.chinese: 上帝啊，我懂得當我躺下長眠不醒時。

sentences.english: I am the star warmly gleaming, over Darnassus softly dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 我是溫暖閃耀的星，照耀達那蘇斯的靜謐長眠。

sentences.english: This is kind of where we think is his resting place.
sentences.chinese: 我們就把這裏當成了他的長眠之地。

sentences.english: His last resting-place is on that hill.
sentences.chinese: 他的長眠處就在那座山上。

sentences.english: Lord I know when I lay me down to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 上帝啊，我知道當我躺下長眠不醒時。

sentences.english: Years went by, and the Princess slept.
sentences.chinese: 年復一年，公主長眠不醒。

sentences.english: The red land with thousand of heroes sleeping in.
sentences.chinese: 紅色故土長眠千萬壯士英豪。

sentences.english: Lord I know when I lay me down 2 sleep.
sentences.chinese: 上帝啊，我知道當我躺下長眠不醒時。

sentences.english: Deeply satisfied, he went back to sleep, and awoke no more in this life.
sentences.chinese: 他滿心歡喜地回去睡覺，從此便長眠不醒。

sentences.english: He rests in a cemetery in the western suburbs of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他長眠於北京西郊的一個公墓中。

sentences.english: The owner of our four clay cows would have been laid in an oval pit.
sentences.chinese: 我們這些小陶牛的墓主被長眠着一座橢圓型的土坑裏。

sentences.english: The body of her grandmother reposes in the churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 她祖母的遺體長眠於教堂的墓地中。

definition: to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to recollect/to recall (past times)/to look back
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
